definition.name: NXcoordinate_system
definition.doc:
Base class to detail a coordinate system (CS).
Whenever possible, an instance of :ref:`NXcoordinate_system` should be used as a member in an :ref:`NXcoordinate_system_set` and the name of the instance should be this alias. This may support a process whereby jargon when talking about coordinate systems and conventions may become cleaner for users because it is not evident for people outside a lab that terms like e.g. tip space or specimen space refer to the same coordinate system. This is an example of jargon used in e.g. the field of atom probe tomography.

field.name: origin
field.doc: Human-readable field telling where the origin of this CS is. Exemplar values could be *left corner of the lab bench*, *door-handle* *pinhole through which the electron beam exists the pole piece*. *barycenter of the triangle*, *center of mass of the stone*.

field.name: alias
field.doc: An alternative name given to that coordinate system.

field.name: handedness
field.doc: Handedness of the coordinate system if it is a Cartesian.

field.name: x_alias
field.doc: Possibility to define an alias for the name of the x-axis.

field.name: x_direction
field.doc:
Human-readable field telling in which direction the x-axis points if that instance of :ref:`NXcoordinate_system` has no reference to any parent and as such is the mighty world reference frame.
Exemplar values could be direction of gravity.

field.name: x
field.doc: Base unit vector along the first axis which spans the coordinate system. This axis is frequently referred to as the x-axis in real space and the i-axis in reciprocal space.

field.name: y_alias
field.doc: Possibility to define an alias for the name of the y-axis.

field.name: y_direction
field.doc:
Human-readable field telling in which direction the y-axis points if that instance of :ref:`NXcoordinate_system` has no reference to any parent and as such is the mighty world reference frame.
See docstring of x_alias for further details.

field.name: y
field.doc: Base unit vector along the second axis which spans the coordinate system. This axis is frequently referred to as the y-axis in real space and the j-axis in reciprocal space.

field.name: z_alias
field.doc: Possibility to define an alias for the name of the z-axis.

field.name: z_direction
field.doc:
Human-readable field telling in which direction the z-axis points if that instance of :ref:`NXcoordinate_system` has no reference to any parent and as such is the mighty world reference frame.
See docstring of x_alias for further details.

field.name: z
field.doc: Base unit vector along the second axis which spans the coordinate system. This axis is frequently referred to as the z-axis in real space and the k-axis in reciprocal space.
